member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.ClassifierShape
member.summary: Defines the type of UML shapes to be drawn.

tr.td: To know more about using Classifier shape, refer to these links
To apply classifier class shape, use the below code.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
               //Defines diagram's Node collection
               public ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection { get; set; }
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                   NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>();
                   DiagramNode Node = new DiagramNode()
                   {
                       Id = "Patient",
                       OffsetX = 200,
                       OffsetY = 200,
                       Shape = new DiagramShape()
                       {
                           Type = Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Shapes.UmlClassifier,
                           Classifier = ClassifierShape.Class,
                           //Define class object
                           ClassShape = new DiagramUmlClass()
                           {
                               Name = "Patient",
                               //Define class attributes
                               Attributes = new ObservableCollection<DiagramUmlClassAttribute>()
                           {
                                   new DiagramUmlClassAttribute() { Name = "accepted", Type = "Date" }
                               },
                               //Define class methods
                               Methods = new ObservableCollection<DiagramUmlClassMethod>()
                           {
                                   new DiagramUmlClassMethod()
                                   {
                                       Name = "getHistory", Type = "getHistory"
                                   }
                               }
                           }
                       }
                   };
                   //Add node
                   NodeCollection.Add(Node);
               }
            }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.ClassifierShape.Aggregation
member.summary: It indicates the scope is a package. Aggregation is a binary association between a property and one or more composite objects which group a set of instances

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.ClassifierShape.Class
member.summary: It indicates the scope is protected. A class describes a set of objects that shares the same specifications of features, constraints, and semantics.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.ClassifierShape.Interface
member.summary: It indicates the scope is private. An Interface is a kind of classifier that represents a declaration of a set of coherent public features and obligations

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.ClassifierShape.Enumeration
member.summary: It indicates the scope is a package.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.ClassifierShape.Inheritance
member.summary: It indicates the scope is protected. Inheritance is also called as generalization. Inheritance is a binary taxonomic directed relationship between a more general classifier (superclass) and a more specific classifier (subclass)

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.ClassifierShape.Association
member.summary: It indicates the scope is private. Association is a set of links that connects elements of a UML model

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.ClassifierShape.Composition
member.summary: It indicates the scope is public. The composition is a strong form of aggregation

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.ClassifierShape.Realization
member.summary: It indicates the scope is protected.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.ClassifierShape.Dependency
member.summary: It indicates the scope is a package. Dependency is a directed relationship, which is used to show that some UML elements need or depends on other model elements for specifications.

example.code:

            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
               ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector> ConnectorCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector>()
               {
                   new DiagramConnector()
                   {
                       SourcePoint=new ConnectorSourcePoint(){X=100,Y=200},
                       TargetPoint=new ConnectorTargetPoint(){X=300,Y=200},
                       ///Sets type to Bpmn, flow to Sequence, and sequence to Conditional
                       Shape=new DiagramConnectorShape()
                       {
                           Type=ConnectionShapes.Bpmn,
                           BpmnFlow=BpmnFlows.Sequence,
                           Sequence=BpmnSequenceFlows.Conditional
                       }
                   }
               };
            }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnSequenceFlows.Normal
member.summary: Sets Sequence flow to Normal.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnSequenceFlows.Default
member.summary: Sets Sequence flow to Default and it has a small crossover line over the flow.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnSequenceFlows.Conditional

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.ConnectionShapes
member.summary: Specifies the type of BPMN connection to be drawn.

tr.td: To know more about using connection shapes, refer to these links
To apply UmlClassifier connection shapes, use the below code.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Connectors="@ConnectorCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code {
               //Defines diagram's connector collection
               public ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector> ConnectorCollection { get; set; }
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                   ConnectorCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector>();
                   DiagramConnector Connector = new DiagramConnector()
                   {
                       Id = "Connector1",
                       Type = Segments.Straight,
                       //Define connector start and end points
                       SourcePoint = new ConnectorSourcePoint() { X = 100, Y = 100 },
                       TargetPoint = new ConnectorTargetPoint() { X = 300, Y = 300 },
                       Shape = new DiagramConnectorShape()
                       {
                           Type = ConnectionShapes.UmlClassifier,
                           Relationship = ClassifierShape.Association,
                           //Define type of association
                           Association = BpmnAssociationFlows.BiDirectional
                       }
                   };
                   //Add connector
                   ConnectorCollection.Add(Connector).
               }
            }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.ConnectionShapes.None
member.summary: Specifies the connection type as a normal connector.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.ConnectionShapes.Bpmn
member.summary: Specifies the connection type as a BPMN connector.

member.summary: Specifies the connection type as a UML activity type connector.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.ConnectionShapes.UmlClassifier
member.summary: Specifies the connection type as a UML classifier type connector.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.UmlActivityFlows
member.summary: UMLActivityFlows enumeration allows the user to set the type of UmlActivity connector.

tr.td: UMLActivityFlows enumeration allows the user to set the type of UmlActivity connector.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Connectors="@ConnectorCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
               public ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector> ConnectorCollection { get; set; }
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                   ConnectorCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector>();
                   DiagramConnector Connector = new DiagramConnector()
                   {
                       Type = Segments.Straight,
                       Shape = new DiagramConnectorShape()
                       {
                           Type = ConnectionShapes.UmlActivity,
                           //Set the UmlActivityFlows to Exception
                           UmlActivityFlow = UmlActivityFlows.Exception
                       },
                       SourcePoint = new ConnectorSourcePoint() { X = 100, Y = 100 },
                       TargetPoint = new ConnectorTargetPoint() { X = 200, Y = 200 }
                   };
                   ConnectorCollection.Add(Connector);
               }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Multiplicity
member.summary: Specifies the multiplicity of uml connector shapes.

tr.td: To know more about using multiplicity, refer to these links
To apply one to many multiplicity, use the below code.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Connectors="@ConnectorCollection">
               </SfDiagram>
            @code{
               //Defines diagram's connector collection
               public ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector> ConnectorCollection { get; set; }
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                   ConnectorCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector>();
                   DiagramConnector Connector = new DiagramConnector()
                   {
                       Id = "Connector1",
                       Type = Segments.Straight,
                       Shape = new DiagramConnectorShape()
                       {
                           Type = ConnectionShapes.UmlClassifier,
                           //Set an relationship for connector
                           Relationship = ClassifierShape.Dependency,
                           Multiplicity = new DiagramClassifierMultiplicity()
                           {
                               //Set multiplicity type
                               Type = Multiplicity.OneToMany,
                               //Set source label to connector
                               Source = new SourceMultiplicityLabel()
                               {
                                   Optional = true,
                                   LowerBounds = "89",
                                   UpperBounds = "67"
                               },
                               //Set target label to a connector
                               Target = new TargetMultiplicityLabel()
                               {
                                   Optional = true,
                                   LowerBounds = "78",
                                   UpperBounds = "90"
                               }
                           }
                       },
                       //Define connector start and endpoints
                       SourcePoint = new ConnectorSourcePoint() { X = 100, Y = 100 },
                       TargetPoint = new ConnectorTargetPoint() { X = 300, Y = 300 }
                   };
                   ConnectorCollection.Add(Connector);
               }
            }

member.summary: Indicates the connector multiplicity is OneToOne.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Multiplicity.OneToMany
member.summary: Indicates the connector multiplicity is OneToMany.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.TooltipMode
member.summary: Allows the user to define how to show the tooltip.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection" Tooltip="@Tooltip">
               </SfDiagram>
            @code{
               public ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection { get; set; }
               // Defines mode of the tooltip
               public DiagramTooltip Tooltip = new DiagramTooltip()
               {
                   Content = "Nodes",
                   OpenOn = TooltipMode.Auto
               };
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                   NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>();
                   ///Defines nodes
                   DiagramNode Node = new DiagramNode()
                   {
                       Width = 100,
                       Height = 100,
                       OffsetX = 200,
                       OffsetY = 200,
                       Constraints = NodeConstraints.Tooltip,
                   };
                   NodeCollection.Add(Node);
               }
            }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.TooltipMode.Auto
member.summary: Displays the tooltip when the object is dragged, scaled or rotated.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.TooltipMode.Custom
member.summary: Displays the tooltip based on the object.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.TooltipRelativeMode
member.summary: The RelativeMode property of the tooltip defines whether the tooltip should be displayed around the object or at the mouse position.

tr.td: By default, the relative mode is set to Mouse.
The following code snippet is an example that sets RelativeMode to the tooltip,

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Constraints="DiagramConstraints.Default | DiagramConstraints.Tooltip" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
               public ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection { get; set; }
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                   NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>();
                   DiagramNode Node = new DiagramNode()
                   {
                       Width = 100,
                       Height = 100,
                       OffsetX = 200,
                       OffsetY = 200,
                       Constraints = NodeConstraints.Default | NodeConstraints.Tooltip,
                       Tooltip = new NodeTooltip()
                       {
                           Content = "Node1",
                           //Sets to show tooltip around the element
                           RelativeMode = TooltipRelativeMode.Object
                       }
                   };
                   NodeCollection.Add(Node);
               }
            }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.TooltipRelativeMode.Object
member.summary: Displays the tooltip around the object when pointed.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.TooltipRelativeMode.Mouse
member.summary: Displays the tooltip at the mouse position when pointed.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Direction
member.summary: Specifies the orthogonal connector's connection segment direction.

tr.td: To know more about using direction, refer to this link:
To apply the connector segment direction, use the below code.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Connectors="@ConnectorCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code
            {
               //Defines diagram's connector collection
               public ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector> ConnectorCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector>();
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                   DiagramConnector DiagramConnector = new DiagramConnector()
                   {
                       SourcePoint = new ConnectorSourcePoint() { X = 100, Y = 100 },
                       TargetPoint = new ConnectorTargetPoint() { X = 200, Y = 200 },
                       TargetDecorator = new ConnectorTargetDecorator()
                       {
                           Shape = DecoratorShapes.Arrow,
                           Style = new DecoratorShapeStyle() { Fill = "#6f409f", StrokeColor = "#6f409f", StrokeWidth = 1 }
                       },
                       Style = new ConnectorShapeStyle() { StrokeColor = "#6f409f", StrokeWidth = 1 },
                       //Specify the connector type as orthogonal.
                       Type = Segments.Orthogonal,
                       //Initialize the segments collection
                       Segments = new ObservableCollection<DiagramConnectorSegment>()
                       {
                           //Create a new segment with length and direction
                           new DiagramConnectorSegment()
                           {
                               Length = 100,
                               Type = Segments.Orthogonal,
                               Direction = Direction.Right,
                           },
                           //Create another new segment with length and direction
                           new DiagramConnectorSegment()
                           {
                               Length = 100,
                               Type = Segments.Orthogonal,
                               Direction = Direction.Top,
                           }
                       },
                   };
                   ConnectorCollection.Add(DiagramConnector);
               }
            }

member.summary: Sets the direction of the connector segment direction to Left.

member.summary: Sets the direction of the connector segment direction to Right.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.NodeConstraints
member.summary: The node constraints allow the users to enable or disable certain behaviors and features of the diagram nodes.

tr.td: The node constraints are enabled or disabled using the bitwise operators. The ~ operator is used to disable the node constraints.
The following code snippet is an example to set node constraints.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
              ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection;
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                   NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>();
                   DiagramNode Node = new DiagramNode()
                   {
                       Id = "node1",
                       Height = 100,
                       Width = 100,
                       OffsetX = 100,
                       OffsetY = 100,
                       //sets the NodeConstraints constraints...
                       Constraints = NodeConstraints.Default & ~NodeConstraints.Rotate
                   };
                   NodeCollection.Add(Node);
               }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.PortConstraints
member.summary: The behavior and features of the ports can be enabled or disabled using the PortConstraints.

tr.td: The port constraints can be enabled or disabled using Bitwise operators. The ~ operator can be used to disable the port constraints.
The below code is an example to set port constraints to disable all functionalities.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
               ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection;
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                   //Initialize the NodeCollection.
                   NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>();
                   DiagramNode Node = new DiagramNode()
                   {
                       Height = 100,
                       Width = 100,
                       OffsetX = 100,
                       OffsetY = 100,
                   };
                   Node.Ports = new ObservableCollection<DiagramPort>()
                   {
                       new DiagramPort()
                       {
                           Offset=new NodePortOffset () {X=0, Y=0.5}, Shape=PortShapes.Circle,
                           Visibility=PortVisibility.Visible,
                           //sets the PortConstraints...
                           Constraints=PortConstraints.None
                       }
                   };
                   NodeCollection.Add(Node);
               }
            }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.PortConstraints.Default
member.summary: Enables all constraints for a port.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.PortConstraints.Drag

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.PortConstraints.InConnect
member.summary: Enables or disables to connect only the target end of connector.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.PortConstraints.None
member.summary: Disables all the Port functionalities.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.PortConstraints.OutConnect
member.summary: Enables or disables to connect only the source end of connector.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.PortShapes
member.summary: Specifies the shape of the ports.

tr.td: To know more about using port shapes, refer to this link
To apply X port shape, use the below code.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
               ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection;
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                   //Initialize the NodeCollection.
                   NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>();
                   DiagramNode Node = new DiagramNode()
                   {
                       Id = "node1",
                       Height = 100,
                       Width = 100,
                       OffsetX = 100,
                       OffsetY = 100,
                   };
                   Node.Ports = new ObservableCollection<DiagramPort>()
                   {
                       new DiagramPort()
                       {
                           Id="port1",
                           Offset=new NodePortOffset(){X=0,Y=0.5},
                           Shape=PortShapes.X,
                           Visibility=PortVisibility.Visible,
                           //sets the PortConstraints...
                           Constraints=PortConstraints.None
                       }
                   };
                   NodeCollection.Add(Node);
               }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.IconShapes
member.summary: Specifies the icon to be shown in the nodes expand or collapsed state.

tr.td: To know more about using icon shapes, refer to these links
To apply icon shape, use the below code.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection" NodeDefaults="@NodeDefault" Connectors="@ConnectorCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
                 public ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>() { };
               public ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector> ConnectorCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramConnector>() { };
               DiagramNode NodeDefault = new DiagramNode()
               {
                   Width = 140,
                   Height = 50,
                   Style = new NodeShapeStyle() { Fill = "#6BA5D7", StrokeColor = "white" },
               };
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                   DiagramNode Node1 = new DiagramNode()
                   {
                       Id = "Start",
                       OffsetX = 300,
                       OffsetY = 50,
                       Annotations = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNodeAnnotation>()
               {
                           new DiagramNodeAnnotation(){ Content = "Node1" }
                       },
                       ExpandIcon = new NodeExpandIcon() { Shape = IconShapes.ArrowDown, Width = 10, Height = 10 },
                       CollapseIcon = new NodeCollapseIcon() { Shape = IconShapes.ArrowUp, Width = 10, Height = 10 }
                   };
                   NodeCollection.Add(Node1);
                   DiagramNode Node2 = new DiagramNode()
                   {
                       Id = "Init",
                       OffsetX = 300,
                       OffsetY = 140,
                       Annotations = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNodeAnnotation>()
                       {
                           new DiagramNodeAnnotation(){ Content = "Node2" }
                       },
                   };
                   NodeCollection.Add(Node2);
                   DiagramConnector Connector = new DiagramConnector()
                   {
                       // Unique name for the connector
                       Id = "connector1",
                       // Source and Target node's name to which connector needs to be connected.
                       SourceID = "Start",
                       TargetID = "Init",
                       Type = Segments.Orthogonal
                   };
                   ConnectorCollection.Add(Connector);
               }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Orientation
member.summary: Specifies the orientation of the layouts.

tr.td: To know more about using Orientation, refer to these links
To apply hierarchical layout orientation, use the below code.

example.code:
<SfDiagram ID="diagram" Height="600px" Layout="@LayoutValue" ConnectorDefaults="@ConnectorDefault" NodeDefaults="@NodeDefaults" SelectedItems="@selectedItems">
               <DiagramDataSource Id = "Name" ParentId="Category" DataSource="@DataSource">
                   <DiagramDataMapSettings>
                       <DiagramDataMapSetting Property = "Shape.TextContent" Field="Name"></DiagramDataMapSetting>
                       <DiagramDataMapSetting Property = "Style.StrokeColor" Field="FillColor"></DiagramDataMapSetting>
                       <DiagramDataMapSetting Property = "Style.Fill" Field="FillColor"></DiagramDataMapSetting>
                   </DiagramDataMapSettings>
               </DiagramDataSource>
               <DiagramPageSettings>
                   <DiagramFitOptions CanFit = "true" Mode="FitModes.Width"></DiagramFitOptions>
               </DiagramPageSettings>
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
               DiagramSelectedItems selectedItems = new DiagramSelectedItems()
               {
                   Constraints = SelectorConstraints.All & ~SelectorConstraints.ResizeAll & ~SelectorConstraints.Rotate
               };
               TreeInfo LayoutInfo = new TreeInfo()
               {
                   CanEnableSubTree = true,
                   Orientation = SubTreeOrientation.Horizontal
               };
               DiagramLayout LayoutValue = new DiagramLayout() { };
               DiagramConnector ConnectorDefault = new DiagramConnector()
               {
                   TargetDecorator = new ConnectorTargetDecorator() { Shape = DecoratorShapes.None },
                   Type = Segments.Orthogonal,
                   Style = new ConnectorShapeStyle() { StrokeColor = "#6d6d6d" },
                   Constraints = 0,
                   CornerRadius = 5
               };
               DiagramNode NodeDefaults = new DiagramNode
               {
                   Style = new NodeShapeStyle() { Fill = "#659be5", StrokeColor = "none", Color = "white", StrokeWidth = 2, },
                   BackgroundColor = "#659be5",
                   Shape = new DiagramShape() { Type = Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Shapes.Text, Margin = new BasicShapeMargin() { Left = 10, Right = 10, Bottom = 10, Top = 10 } },
                   ExpandIcon = new NodeExpandIcon()
                   {
                       Height = 10,
                       Width = 10,
                       Shape = IconShapes.Minus,
                       Fill = "lightgray",
                       Offset = new IconOffset() { X = 0.5, Y = 1 },
                       VerticalAlignment = VerticalAlignment.Auto,
                       Margin = new ExpandIconMargin() { Bottom = 0, Left = 0, Right = 0, Top = 0 }
                   },
                   CollapseIcon = new NodeCollapseIcon()
                   {
                       Offset = new IconOffset() { X = 0.5, Y = 1 },
                       VerticalAlignment = VerticalAlignment.Auto,
                       Height = 10,
                       Width = 10,
                       Shape = IconShapes.Plus,
                       Fill = "lightgray",
                       Padding = new IconPadding() { Top = 5 }
                   }
               };
               public class HierarchicalDetails
               {
                   public string Name { get; set; }
                   public string FillColor { get; set; }
                   public string Category { get; set; }
               }
               public List<object> DataSource = new List<object>()
               {
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Diagram", Category="",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Layout", Category="Diagram",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Tree layout", Category="Layout",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Organizational chart", Category="Layout",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Hierarchical tree", Category="Tree layout",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Radial tree", Category="Tree layout",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Mind map", Category="Hierarchical tree",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Family tree", Category="Hierarchical tree",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Management", Category="Organizational chart",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Human resources", Category="Management",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="University", Category="Management",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Business", Category="#Management",FillColor="#659be5"}
               };
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                   LayoutValue = new DiagramLayout()
                   {
                       Type = LayoutType.HierarchicalTree,
                       VerticalSpacing = 30,
                       HorizontalSpacing = 30,
                       EnableAnimation = true,
                       LayoutInfo = this.LayoutInfo
                   };
               }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.SubTreeAlignments
member.summary: Specifies the subtree alignments in an organizational chart.

tr.td: To know more about using the Subtree Alignments, refer to this link
To apply the Subtree Alignments, use the below code.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" NodeDefaults="@NodeDefaults" ConnectorDefaults="@ConnectorDefaults" Layout="@LayoutValue">
               <DiagramDataSource Id = "Id" ParentId="Team" DataSource="@DataSource" ></DiagramDataSource>
            </SfDiagram>
            @code {
               //Initializing layout
               DiagramLayout LayoutValue;
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                   LayoutValue = new DiagramLayout()
                   {
                       //Sets layout type as OrganizationalChart...
                       Type = LayoutType.OrganizationalChart,
                       VerticalSpacing = 50,
                       HorizontalSpacing = 40,
                       //Initialize the layout info for the org chart layout
                       LayoutInfo = new TreeInfo
                       {
                           Orientation = SubTreeOrientation.Vertical,
                           CanEnableSubTree = true,
                       }
                   };
               }
               //Initializing node defaults
               DiagramNode NodeDefaults = new DiagramNode()
               {
                   Width = 150,
                   Height = 50,
                   Annotations = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNodeAnnotation>() { new DiagramNodeAnnotation() { Id = "label1", Style = new AnnotationStyle() { Color = "white" } }, },
                   Style = new NodeShapeStyle { Fill = "#6BA5D7", StrokeColor = "black", },
                   LayoutInfo = new DiagramNodeLayoutInfo()
                   {
                       Orientation = Orientation.Vertical,
                       Type = SubTreeAlignments.Right
                   }
               };
               //Initializing connector defaults
               DiagramConnector ConnectorDefaults = new DiagramConnector()
               {
                   Type = Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Segments.Orthogonal,
                   Style = new ConnectorShapeStyle() { StrokeColor = "#6BA5D7", StrokeWidth = 1 },
                   TargetDecorator = new ConnectorTargetDecorator()
                   {
                       Shape = DecoratorShapes.None,
                       Style = new DecoratorShapeStyle() { Fill = "#6BA5D7", StrokeColor = "#6BA5D7", },
                   }
               };
               public class OrgChartDataModel
               {
                   public string Id { get; set; }
                   public string Team { get; set; }
                   public string Role { get; set; }
               }
               public object DataSource = new List<object>()
               {
                   new OrgChartDataModel() { Id= "1", Role= "General Manager" },
                   new OrgChartDataModel() { Id= "2", Role= "Human Resource Manager", Team= "1" },
                   new OrgChartDataModel() { Id= "3", Role= "Design Manager", Team= "1" },
                   new OrgChartDataModel() { Id= "4", Role= "Operation Manager", Team= "1" },
                   new OrgChartDataModel() { Id= "5", Role= "Marketing Manager", Team= "1" }
               };
            }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.SubTreeAlignments.Alternate
member.summary: Aligns the child nodes at both left and right sides of the parent in a vertical subtree.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.SubTreeAlignments.Balanced
member.summary: Aligns the child nodes in multiple rows to balance the width and height of the horizontal subtree.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BasicShapes
member.summary: Specifies the common shapes that are used to represent information visually.

tr.td: To know more about using basic shapes, refer to these links
To apply basic shape, use the below code.

example.code:
<SfSymbolPalette ID="palettes" Height="600px" SymbolHeight=60 SymbolWidth=60 Palettes="@Palettes">
            </SfSymbolPalette>
            @code{
               public ObservableCollection<SymbolPalettePalette> Palettes;
               /// Defines palette's basic-shape collection
               public ObservableCollection<Object> BasicShapes { get; set; }
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                   Palettes = new ObservableCollection<SymbolPalettePalette>();
                   BasicShapes = new ObservableCollection<Object>()
                   {
                        new DiagramNode()
                        {
                            Id = "Rectangle",
                            Shape = new DiagramShape() {
                            Type = Shapes.Basic, BasicShape = Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BasicShapes.Rectangle
                            }
                        },
                        new DiagramNode()
                        {
                            Id="Ellipse",
                            Shape = new DiagramShape() {
                            Type = Shapes.Basic, BasicShape = Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BasicShapes.Ellipse
                            }
                        },
                        new DiagramNode()
                        {
                            Id="Hexagon",
                            Shape = new DiagramShape() {
                            Type = Shapes.Basic, BasicShape = Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BasicShapes.Hexagon
                            }
                        }
                    };
                   Palettes.Add(new SymbolPalettePalette() { Id = "BasicShapes", Expanded = true, Symbols = BasicShapes, Title = "Basicshapes" });
               }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnShapes
member.summary: The graphical representation of the internal business procedure and communicating the procedures in a standard manner is done using BpmnShapes. The BPMN stands for Business Process Model and Notation.

tr.td: All the BPMN shapes represent the business process.
The following links can be used in understanding BpmnShapes,

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection"> </SfDiagram>
            @code{
               ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>()
               {
                   new DiagramNode()
                   {
                       OffsetX = 100, OffsetY = 100,
                       Width = 100, Height = 100,
                       Shape = new DiagramShape()
                       {
                           Type = Shapes.Bpmn,
                           BpmnShape = BpmnShapes.DataSource
                       }
                   }
               };
            }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnShapes.Event
member.summary: Sets the Bpmn shape type to Event and it is represented with a circle-like shape.

member.summary: Sets the Bpmn shape type to Gateway and it is represented with a diamond-like shape.

member.summary: Sets the Bpmn shape type to Message.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.FlowShapes
member.summary: Specifies the type of process flow used for analyzing designing and managing for documentation process.

tr.td: To apply flow shape, use the below code.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection"/>
            @code{
               //Initialize node collection with node
               ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>()
               {
                    //Creates a flow shape node
                    new DiagramNode()
                    {
                        Id="node1",
                        //Size of the node
                        Height=100,
                        Width=100,
                        //Position of the node
                        OffsetX=100,
                        OffsetY=100,
                        //Sets the type of the shape as flow
                        Shape=new DiagramShape()
                        {
                            Type=Shapes.Flow,
                            FlowShape=FlowShapes.DirectData
                        }
                    }
               };
            }

member.summary: Sets the flow shape type as Terminator.

member.summary: Sets the flow shape type as Process.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Stretch
member.summary: Allows the user to define how to stretch the image.

tr.td: The below code snippet is an example to set Stretch to a node.

example.code:
<input type="button" value="Export" @onclick="@OnExport" />
            <SfDiagram Height="600px" @ref="@Diagram">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
                SfDiagram Diagram;
               private void OnExport()
               {
                   IExportOptions options = new IExportOptions()
                   {
                       Mode = ExportModes.Data,
                       FileName = "region",
                       Stretch = Stretch.Stretch,
                       Region = DiagramRegions.Content,
                       Format = FileFormats.SVG
                   };
                   Diagram.ExportDiagram(options);
               }
            }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Stretch.None
member.summary: Does not preserve aspect ratio. Scales image to fit view box fully into viewport. Proportions will be distorted

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Stretch.Stretch
member.summary: Stretch the entire image to the page in both horizontally and vertically.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Stretch.Meet
member.summary: Preserves aspect ratio and scales view box to fit within page size.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Stretch.Slice
member.summary: Preserves aspect ratio and slices off any part of the image that does not fit inside page size.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Shapes
member.summary: Specifies the type of a node.

tr.td: To know more about using the Shapes, refer to this link
To apply text shape to a node, use the below code.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
                //Initialize node collection with node
                ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>()
                {
                   //Creates a text node
                    new DiagramNode()
                    {
                        Id="node1",
                        // Size of the node
                        Height=100,
                        Width=100,
                        // Position of the node
                        OffsetX=100,
                        OffsetY=100,
                        //Sets type of the shape as text
                        Shape=new DiagramShape(){Type=Shapes.Text,Content="Text Node"}
                    }
                };
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.UmlActivityShapes
member.summary: The UML activity diagram is a flowchart that represents the flow from one activity to another. It describes the activity flow of a system, and the parallel flow of a system.

tr.td: The below code snippet is an example to set UMLActivity shape.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
               //Defines diagram's connector collection
               public ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection { get; set; }
               public DiagramConstraints diagramConstraints = DiagramConstraints.Default;
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                   NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>();
                   DiagramNode node = new DiagramNode()
                   {
                       Width = 100,
                       Height = 100,
                       OffsetX = 200,
                       OffsetY = 200,
                       Shape = new DiagramShape()
                       {
                           Type = Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Shapes.UmlActivity,
                           //Define UmlActivity shape
                           UmlActivityShape = UmlActivityShapes.Action
                       }
                   };
                   NodeCollection.Add(node);
               }
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.UmlScope
member.summary: Defines the scope of the UML shape.

tr.td: The following code snippet is an example to set the UMLScope to Private,

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
               public ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection { get; set; }
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                   NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>();
                   DiagramNode node = new DiagramNode()
                   {
                       Id = "Patient",
                       OffsetX = 200,
                       OffsetY = 200,
                       Shape = new DiagramShape()
                       {
                           Type = Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Shapes.UmlClassifier,
                           Classifier = ClassifierShape.Class,
                           //Define class object
                           ClassShape = new DiagramUmlClass()
                           {
                               Name = "Patient",
                               Attributes = new ObservableCollection<DiagramUmlClassAttribute>()
                               {
                                   new DiagramUmlClassAttribute() { Name = "accepted", Type = "Date" }
                               },
                               //Define class methods
                               Methods = new ObservableCollection<DiagramUmlClassMethod>()
                               {
                                   new DiagramUmlClassMethod()
                                   {
                                       Name = "getHistory", Type = "getHistory",Scope=UmlScope.Private
                                   }
                               }
                           }
                       }
                   };
                   NodeCollection.Add(node);
               }
            }

member.summary: Sets the scope of the attribute to Public

member.summary: Sets the scope of the attribute to Protected

member.summary: Sets the scope of the attribute to Private

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.GradientType
member.summary: Specifies the type of transition between two or more colors.

tr.td: To know more about using Gradient type, refer to these links

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
               public ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>() { };
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                   // A node is created and stored in nodes array.
                   DiagramNode node1 = new DiagramNode()
                   {
                       // Position of the node
                       OffsetX = 250,
                       OffsetY = 250,
                       // Size of the node
                       Width = 100,
                       Height = 100,
                       Style = new NodeShapeStyle()
                       {
                           Gradient = new DiagramGradient()
                           {
                               //Start point of linear gradient
                               X1 = 0,
                               Y1 = 0,
                               //End point of linear gradient
                               X2 = 50,
                               Y2 = 50,
                               //Sets an array of stop objects
                               Stops = new ObservableCollection<DiagramsGradientStop>()
                               {
                                   new DiagramsGradientStop(){ Color = "white", Offset = 0},
                                   new DiagramsGradientStop(){ Color = "#6BA5D7", Offset = 100}
                               },
                               Type = GradientType.Linear
                           }
                       },
                   };
                   NodeCollection.Add(node1);
               }
            }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.GradientType.None
member.summary: No gradient will be applied by default.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.GradientType.Linear
member.summary: Sets the type of gradient as Linear.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.GradientType.Radial
member.summary: Sets the type of gradient as Radial.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnEvents
member.summary: A common BPMN process model element that represents some happening during a business process is an Event.
member.remarks: The below code snippet is an example to set the BpmnEvents,.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
               <DiagramSnapSettings Constraints = "@SnapConstraints.None" ></ DiagramSnapSettings >
            </ SfDiagram >
            @code{
               ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>()
               {
                   new DiagramNode()
                   {`
                       OffsetX = 100, OffsetY = 100,
                       Width = 100, Height = 100,
                       Shape = new DiagramShape()
                       {
                           ///Sets type to Bpmn and shape to Event
                           Type = Shapes.Bpmn, BpmnShape = BpmnShapes.Event,
                           /// Set the event type to NonInterruptingIntermediate
                           Event = new DiagramBpmnEvent() { Event = BpmnEvents.NonInterruptingIntermediate }
                       }
                   }
               };
            }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnEvents.Start
member.summary: Indicates the beginning of the process and every business process starts with an event.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnEvents.Intermediate
member.summary: Indicates the ongoing stage (Middle after starting and before ending) of the process.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnEvents.End
member.summary: Indicates the beginning of the process and every business process ends with an event.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnEvents.NonInterruptingStart
member.summary: Sets the type of the BPMN Event as NonInterruptingStart.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnEvents.NonInterruptingIntermediate
member.summary: Sets the type of the BPMN Event as NonInterruptingIntermediate.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnEvents.ThrowingIntermediate
member.summary: Sets the type of the BPMN Event as ThrowingIntermediate.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnTriggers
member.summary: The Trigger property of the node allows the user to set the type of BPMN trigger. Triggers are notated as icons inside the circle.

tr.td: The Trigger members can be set to any one of the BPMN events.
The following code snippet is an example to set Trigger to NonInterruptingIntermediate Bpmn event.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
               //Initialize the node collection with node
               ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>()
               {
                   new DiagramNode()
                   {
                       OffsetX = 100, OffsetY = 100, Width = 100, Height = 100,
                       Shape = new DiagramShape()
                       {
                           Type = Shapes.Bpmn, BpmnShape = BpmnShapes.Event,
                           // Set the event type to NonInterruptingIntermediate and set the trigger as message
                           Event = new DiagramBpmnEvent() { Event = BpmnEvents.NonInterruptingIntermediate }
                       }
                   }
               };
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnGateways
member.summary: The Gateway controls the flow of a process and it is represented by a diamond shape. This enumeration defines the type of gateway to be set in the BPMN shape.

tr.td: The BPMN Gateway can be set to Complex, EventBased, etc., All the gateway shapes are covered by a diamond-like shape in the outer.
The below code snippet is an example to set BPMN Gateways,

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
               //Initialize the node collection with node
               ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>()
               {
                   new DiagramNode()
                   {
                       OffsetX = 100, OffsetY = 100,
                       Width = 100, Height = 100,
                       Shape = new DiagramShape()
                       {
                           Type = Shapes.Bpmn, BpmnShape = BpmnShapes.Gateway,
                           ///Sets type of the gateway to None
                           Gateway = new DiagramBpmnGateway(){Type = BpmnGateways.Parallel}
                       }
                   }
               };
            }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnGateways.None
member.summary: Sets the gateway type to None and it is represented by a diamond(gateway) shape with no symbols in it.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnGateways.Exclusive
member.summary: Sets the gateway type to Exclusive and it is represented by a cross symbol inside the gateway shape.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnGateways.Inclusive
member.summary: Sets the gateway type to Inclusive and it is represented by a circle inside the gateway shape.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnGateways.Parallel
member.summary: Sets the gateway type to Parallel. It is represented by an addition sign inside the gateway shape.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnGateways.Complex
member.summary: Sets the gateway type to Complex and it is represented by an asterisk symbol inside the gateway.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnGateways.EventBased
member.summary: Sets the gateway type to Event.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnGateways.ExclusiveEventBased
member.summary: Sets the gateway type to ExclusiveEventBased.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnGateways.ParallelEventBased
member.summary: Sets the gateway type to ParallelEventBased.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnDataObjects
member.summary: A data object represents the information flowing throughout the BPMN process. This enumeration defines the type of Data object to be set in the BPMN shape.

tr.td: The BPMN Data object can be set to Input, Output or None.
The below code is an example to set BPMN Data objects

example.code:
<SfDiagram ID="Diagram" Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
               ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>()
               {
                   new DiagramNode()
                   {
                       OffsetX = 100,
                       OffsetY = 100,
                       Width = 100,
                       Height = 100,
                       //Sets type to Bpmn and shape to DataObject
                       Shape = new DiagramShape()
                       {
                           Type = Shapes.Bpmn,
                           BpmnShape=BpmnShapes.DataObject,
                           //Sets collection to true when Dataobject is not a Single instance
                           DataObject=new DiagramBpmnDataObject()
                           {
                               Collection=true,
                               Type=BpmnDataObjects.Input
                           }
                       }
                   },
                };
            }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnDataObjects.None
member.summary: The BPMN Data object type is set to None.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnDataObjects.Input
member.summary: The BPMN Data object type is set to Input.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnDataObjects.Output
member.summary: The BPMN Data object type is set to Output.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnActivities
member.summary: The BPMN activity is a task performed in a business process and it is represented by a rounded rectangle.

tr.td: To know more about BpmnActivities, refer the following links:
The following code snippet demonstrates how to set BPMNActivity to Task.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
                ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>()
                {
                   new DiagramNode()
                   {
                       OffsetX = 100, OffsetY = 100,
                       Width = 100, Height = 100,
                       Shape = new DiagramShape()
                       {
                           Type = Shapes.Bpmn,
                           BpmnShape = BpmnShapes.Activity,
                           ///Sets the activity type to task
                           Activity = new DiagramBpmnActivity(){ Activity = BpmnActivities.Task },
                       }
                   }
               };
            }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnActivities.Task
member.summary: Sets the BPMN activity as Task.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnActivities.None
member.summary: Renders a BPMN activity shape of type None.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnActivities.SubProcess
member.summary: Defines the BPMN activity to Subprocess.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnLoops
member.summary: The loop property of a task allows the user to define the type of loop. Loop is a task looped internally. Loops can be set to both tasks and subprocesses.
member.remarks: By default, Loops are set to None.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
               ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>()
               {
                   new DiagramNode()
                   {
                       OffsetX = 100, OffsetY = 100,
                       Width = 100,
                       Height = 100,
                       Shape = new DiagramShape()
                       {
                           Type = Shapes.Bpmn,
                           BpmnShape = BpmnShapes.Activity,
                           Activity = new DiagramBpmnActivity()
                           {
                               Activity = BpmnActivities.Task,
                               ///Sets collapsed to true and loop to standard
                               Task=new DiagramBpmnTask()
                               {
                                   Loop = BpmnLoops.SequenceMultiInstance,
                               }, }
                       }
                    }
               };
            }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnLoops.None
member.summary: Sets the loop for task or subprocess as None.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnLoops.Standard
member.summary: Sets the loop for task or subprocess as Standard.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnLoops.ParallelMultiInstance
member.summary: Sets the loop for task or subprocess as ParallelMultiInstance.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnLoops.SequenceMultiInstance
member.summary: Sets the loop for task or subprocess as SequenceMultiInstance.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnTasks
member.summary: The Task property allows the users to define the type of task such as sending, receiving, etc.,.

tr.td: The following links can be used in understanding Tasks,

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
               ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>()
               {
                   new DiagramNode()
                   {
                       OffsetX = 100, Off   setY = 100, Width = 100, Height = 100,
                       Shape = new DiagramShape()
                       {
                           Type = Shapes.Bpmn, BpmnShape = BpmnShapes.Activity,
                           Activity = new DiagramBpmnActivity()
                           {
                               Activity = BpmnActivities.Task,
                               //Sets the type of the task to BusinessRule
                               Task = new DiagramBpmnTask(){ Type = BpmnTasks.BusinessRule }
                           }
                       }
                   }
               };
            }

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnBoundary
member.summary: The boundary represents the type of task that is being processed. The boundary property of subprocess allows you to define the type of boundary.

tr.td: By default, BpmnBoundary is set to Default.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
            ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>()
            {
                   new DiagramNode()
                   {
                       OffsetX = 100, OffsetY = 100, Width = 100, Height = 100,
                       Shape = new DiagramShape()
                       {
                           Type = Shapes.Bpmn, BpmnShape = BpmnShapes.Activity,
                           Activity = new DiagramBpmnActivity()
                           {
                               Activity = BpmnActivities.SubProcess,
                               ///Sets collapsed to true and boundary to Call
                               SubProcess = new DiagramBpmnSubProcess()
                               {
                                   Collapsed = true,
                                   Boundary = BpmnBoundary.Call
                               },
                           }
                       }
                   },
               };
            }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnBoundary.Default
member.summary: Sets the boundary to Default.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnBoundary.Call
member.summary: Sets the boundary to Call and it is represented with a bolder layout.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnBoundary.Event
member.summary: Sets the boundary to Event and it is represented with a dotted layout.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnSubProcessTypes
member.summary: A group of tasks that are used to hide or reveal details of additional levels using the Collapsed property are known as Subprocess.

tr.td: The following links might be helpful in understanding Subprocess

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
               ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>()
               {
                   new DiagramNode()
                   {
                       OffsetX = 100, OffsetY = 100,Width = 100, Height = 100,
                       Shape = new DiagramShape()
                       {
                           Type = Shapes.Bpmn, BpmnShape = BpmnShapes.Activity,
                           ///Sets activity to SubProcess
                           Activity=new DiagramBpmnActivity()
                           {
                               Activity = BpmnActivities.SubProcess,
                               ///Sets the collapsed to true and type to Event
                               SubProcess=new DiagramBpmnSubProcess()
                               {
                                   Collapsed = true, Type = BpmnSubProcessTypes.Transaction,
                               }
                            }
                       }
                   }
               };
            }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnSubProcessTypes.None
member.summary: Sets the Subprocess to None.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnSubProcessTypes.Transaction
member.summary: A Transaction is a set of activities that logically belong together to be completed.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BpmnSubProcessTypes.Event
member.summary: A Subprocess is an events subprocess triggered by an event. The Type property of the subprocess allows users to define the type of subprocess.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.ScrollLimit.Diagram
member.summary: Enables scrolling to view the diagram content.

member.summary: Diagram will be extended, when we try to scroll the diagram.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.ScrollLimit.Limited
member.summary: Enables scrolling to view the specified area.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.SnapConstraints
member.summary: Specifies the constraints to enable/ disable snapping and to controls the visibility of gridlines.

tr.td: To know more about using the snap constraints, refer to this link
To apply show horizontal lines snap constraints, use the below code.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
               @* Initialize the snapsettings with constraints *@
               <DiagramSnapSettings Constraints = "SnapConstraints.ShowHorizontalLines" ></ DiagramSnapSettings >
            </ SfDiagram >
            @code{
               ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection;
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                   //Initialize the NodeCollection.
                   NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>();
                   DiagramNode node = new DiagramNode()
                   {
                       Id = "node1",
                       Height = 100,
                       Width = 100,
                       OffsetX = 100,
                       OffsetY = 100,
                   };
                   NodeCollection.Add(node);
               }
            }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.SnapConstraints.All

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.SnapConstraints.None

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.SnapConstraints.ShowLines

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.SnapConstraints.ShowVerticalLines

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.SnapConstraints.SnapToHorizontalLines

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.SnapConstraints.SnapToLines

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.SnapConstraints.SnapToObject

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.SnapConstraints.SnapToVerticalLines

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BoundaryConstraints
member.summary: It allows the users to set the region to allow interaction with the diagram.
member.remarks: The boundary constraints are enabled or disabled using the Bitwise operators. The ~ operator is used to disable the boundary constraints. The boundary constraints can be enabled in the DiagramPageSettings.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection">
               // Initialize the page settings with boundary constraints.
               <DiagramPageSettings Height = "500" BoundaryConstraints="BoundaryConstraints.Page"></DiagramPageSettings>
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
               ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection;
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                   NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>();
                   DiagramNode node = new DiagramNode()
                   {
                       Height = 100,
                       Width = 100,
                       OffsetX = 100,
                       OffsetY = 100,
                   };
                   NodeCollection.Add(node);
               }
            }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BoundaryConstraints.Infinity
member.summary: Allow the interactions to take place at the infinite height and width.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BoundaryConstraints.Diagram
member.summary: Allow the interactions to take place around the diagram height and width.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.BoundaryConstraints.Page
member.summary: Allow the interactions to take place around the height and width mentioned on the page settings.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.PageOrientation
member.summary: Specifies the orientation of the page.

tr.td: To know more about using Page Orientation, refer to this link
To apply page orientation, use the below code.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" id="diagram">
               @* Initialize the page settings with page orientation and break lines*@
               <DiagramPageSettings Height = "300" Width="500" Orientation="PageOrientation.Portrait" ShowPageBreaks="true">
               </DiagramPageSettings>
            </SfDiagram>
            @code
            {
               //Defines diagram's nodes collection
               public ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>();
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                   DiagramNode node = new DiagramNode()
                   {
                       Id = "group",
                       OffsetX = 200,
                       OffsetY = 200,
                       Width = 100,
                       Height = 100,
                       Annotations = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNodeAnnotation>()
                       {
                           new DiagramNodeAnnotation()
                           {
                               Content = "Node1",
                               Style = new AnnotationStyle()
                               {
                                   Color = "white",
                               }
                           }
                       },
                       Style = new NodeShapeStyle() { Fill = "cornflowerblue", StrokeColor = "white" }
                   };
                   NodeCollection.Add(node);
               }
            }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.PageOrientation.Landscape
member.summary: Specifies the page Width is more than the page Height.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.PageOrientation.Portrait
member.summary: Specifies the page Height is more than the page width.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Scale
member.summary: It allows the user to stretch the image as desired.

tr.td: To know more about using the scale, refer to these links
To apply the scale to meet, use the below code.

example.code:
<SfDiagram Height="600px" Nodes="@NodeCollection"/>
            @code{
               //Initialize node collection with node
               ObservableCollection<DiagramNode> NodeCollection = new ObservableCollection<DiagramNode>()
               {
                    //Creates an image node
                    new DiagramNode()
                    {
                        Id="node1",
                        //Size of the node
                        Height=100,
                        Width=100,
                        //Position of the node
                        OffsetX=100,
                        OffsetY=100,
                        //Sets type of the shape as image
                        Shape=new DiagramShape (){Type=Shapes.Image,Source="/diagram/images/syncfusion.png",Scale=Stretch.Meet, Align = ImageAlignment.XMinYMin}
                    }
               };
            }

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Scale.None
member.summary: There will be no scaling to the image.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Scale.Meet
member.summary: It aligns the image to the center of the node.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Scale.Slice
member.summary: It zooms in to fill the node.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.FitModes
member.summary: Specifies how the diagram has to be fit into the viewport.

tr.td: To know more about using fit modes, refer to this link:
To apply fit modes, use the below code.

example.code:
<SfDiagram ID="diagram" Height="600px" Layout="@LayoutValue" ConnectorDefaults="@ConnectorDefault" NodeDefaults="@NodeDefaults" SelectedItems="@SelectedItems">
               <DiagramDataSource Id = "Name" ParentId="Category" DataSource="@DataSource">
                   <DiagramDataMapSettings>
                       <DiagramDataMapSetting Property = "Shape.TextContent" Field="Name"></DiagramDataMapSetting>
                       <DiagramDataMapSetting Property = "Style.StrokeColor" Field="FillColor"></DiagramDataMapSetting>
                       <DiagramDataMapSetting Property = "Style.Fill" Field="FillColor"></DiagramDataMapSetting>
                   </DiagramDataMapSettings>
               </DiagramDataSource>
               <DiagramPageSettings>
                   <DiagramFitOptions CanFit = "true" Mode="FitModes.Height"></DiagramFitOptions>
               </DiagramPageSettings>
            </SfDiagram>
            @code{
               DiagramSelectedItems SelectedItems = new DiagramSelectedItems()
               {
                   Constraints = SelectorConstraints.All & ~SelectorConstraints.ResizeAll & ~SelectorConstraints.Rotate
               };
               TreeInfo LayoutInfo = new TreeInfo()
               {
                   CanEnableSubTree = true,
                   Orientation = SubTreeOrientation.Horizontal
               };
               DiagramLayout LayoutValue = new DiagramLayout() { };
               DiagramConnector ConnectorDefault = new DiagramConnector()
               {
                   TargetDecorator = new ConnectorTargetDecorator() { Shape = DecoratorShapes.None },
                   Type = Segments.Orthogonal,
                   Style = new ConnectorShapeStyle() { StrokeColor = "#6d6d6d" },
                   Constraints = 0,
                   CornerRadius = 5
               };
               DiagramNode NodeDefaults = new DiagramNode
               {
                   Style = new NodeShapeStyle() { Fill = "#659be5", StrokeColor = "none", Color = "white", StrokeWidth = 2, },
                   BackgroundColor = "#659be5",
                   Shape = new DiagramShape() { Type = Syncfusion.Blazor.Diagrams.Shapes.Text, Margin = new BasicShapeMargin() { Left = 10, Right = 10, Bottom = 10, Top = 10 } },
                   ExpandIcon = new NodeExpandIcon()
                   {
                       Height = 10,
                       Width = 10,
                       Shape = IconShapes.Minus,
                       Fill = "lightgray",
                       Offset = new IconOffset() { X = 0.5, Y = 1 },
                       VerticalAlignment = VerticalAlignment.Auto,
                       Margin = new ExpandIconMargin() { Bottom = 0, Left = 0, Right = 0, Top = 0 }
                   },
                   CollapseIcon = new NodeCollapseIcon()
                   {
                       Offset = new IconOffset() { X = 0.5, Y = 1 },
                       VerticalAlignment = VerticalAlignment.Auto,
                       Height = 10,
                       Width = 10,
                       Shape = IconShapes.Plus,
                       Fill = "lightgray",
                       Padding = new IconPadding() { Top = 5 }
                   }
               };
               public class HierarchicalDetails
               {
                   public string Name { get; set; }
                   public string FillColor { get; set; }
                   public string Category { get; set; }
               }
               public List<object> DataSource = new List<object>()
               {
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Diagram", Category="",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Layout", Category="Diagram",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Tree layout", Category="Layout",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Organizational chart", Category="Layout",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Hierarchical tree", Category="Tree layout",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Radial tree", Category="Tree layout",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Mind map", Category="Hierarchical tree",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Family tree", Category="Hierarchical tree",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Management", Category="Organizational chart",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Human resources", Category="Management",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="University", Category="Management",FillColor="#659be5"},
                   new HierarchicalDetails(){ Name ="Business", Category="#Management",FillColor="#659be5"}
               };
               protected override void OnInitialized()
               {
                   LayoutValue = new DiagramLayout()
                   {
                       Type = LayoutType.HierarchicalTree,
                       VerticalSpacing = 30,
                       HorizontalSpacing = 30,
                       EnableAnimation = true,
                       LayoutInfo = this.LayoutInfo
                   };
               }
            }
